intro: Crotalaria huillensis, commonly known as the Huillén's spurred cowpea, is a species of flowering plant native to South America, particularly found in Peru and Bolivia. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which is characterized by its pod-bearing fruits and nitrogen-fixing capabilities. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. Its distinctive features include spurred petals and compound leaves, which are typical of the genus Crotalaria. It is also valued for its ornamental appeal and potential ecological benefits in soil enrichment.
